item.title: Microsoft 365 apps will prompt users to back up files in OneDrive
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Starting mid-March 2025, Microsoft will start prompting users of its Microsoft 365 apps for Windows to back up their files to OneDrive. [...]

item.title: Over 37,000 VMware ESXi servers vulnerable to ongoing attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 37,000 internet-exposed VMware ESXi instances are vulnerable to CVE-2025-22224, a critical out-of-bounds write flaw that is actively exploited in the wild. [...]

item.title: Free vCISO Course: Turning MSPs and MSSPs into Cybersecurity Powerhouses
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Cynomi
item.description: The vCISO Academy is a free learning platform to equip service providers with training needed to build and expand their vCISO offerings. Learn more from Cynomi on how the Academy helps you launch or expand your vCISO services. [...]

item.title: Malicious Chrome extensions can spoof password managers in new attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A newly devised "polymorphic" attack allows maliciousÂ Chrome extensions to morph into other browser extensions, including password managers, crypto wallets, and banking apps, to steal sensitive information. [...]

item.title: Open-source tool 'Rayhunter' helps users detect Stingray attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) has released a free, open-source tool named Rayhunter that is designed to detect cell-site simulators (CSS), also known as IMSI catchers or Stingrays. [...]

item.title: Silk Typhoon hackers now target IT supply chains to breach networks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft warns that Chinese cyber-espionage threat group 'Silk Typhoon' has shifted its tactics, now targeting remote management tools and cloud services in supply chain attacks that give them access to downstream customers. [...]

item.title: US charges Chinese hackers linked to critical infrastructure breaches
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The US Justice Department has charged Chinese state security officers along with APT27 and i-Soon hackers for network breaches and cyberattacks that have targeted victims globally since 2011. [...]

item.title: BadBox malware disrupted on 500K infected Android devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The BadBox Android malware botnet has been disrupted again by removing 24 malicious apps from Google Play and sinkholing communications for half a million infected devices. [...]

item.title: YouTube warns of AI-generated video of its CEO used in phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: YouTube warns that scammers are using an AI-generated video featuring the company's CEO in phishing attacks to steal creators' credentials. [...]

item.title: Look up: The new frontier of cyberthreats is in the sky
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Acronis
item.description: With increased unidentified drone sightings worldwide, some are concerned they pose a cybersecurity risk. Learn more from Acronis about these risks and a real attack on a Taiwan drone manufacturer. [...]

item.title: Toronto Zoo shares update on last year's ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Toronto Zoo, the largest zoo in Canada, has provided more information about the data stolen during a ransomware attack in January 2024. [...]

item.title: Fake BianLian ransom notes mailed to US CEOs in postal mail scam
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Scammers are impersonating the BianLian ransomware gang in fake ransom notes sent to US companies via snail mail through the United States Postal Service. [...]
